course.subject: GBUS
course.name: Value Investing in Global Markets
course.description: This course covers the basic theory and philosophy of value investing as it has developed since Graham. We will introduce and discuss the styles of important value investors including Graham and Buffett. We will present the basic techniques of investing: search; valuation and the construction of a portfolio. We will use the framework developed in class to study specific companies. This course will only focus on equities. For GBUS students or students with consent from the instructor.

reviews.author: smallpotatoes
reviews.title: BEST course for investment ever
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction and application of value investing approach including but not limited to: (1) philosophy, (2) picking companies; (3) valuation etc

I would say the philosophy would be very useful on how i invest in future
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very captive teaching that you will get 120% of the content taught in class

prof is humorous as well
reviews.comment_grading: no grading yet but i think its alright
reviews.comment_workload:
The prof will tell you at the very beginning that there will be tons of workload for the course. Actually it is very manageable for a GBUS student.

two group presentations
some assignments (mostly reading comprehension)
midterm (open-book)
a final group paper
An optional bonus presentation
